com.spears.environments

Class EnvironmentPopulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.spears.environments.EnvironmentPopulator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AquaticTargetsPop, GenericEnvironmentalPopulator, TerrainHazardsPop, TerrainTargetsPop

    public abstract class EnvironmentPopulator
extends java.lang.Object
    Populators add unique elements to environment in addition to the map.

      • EnvironmentPopulator

        protected EnvironmentPopulator(java.lang.String type,
                               java.lang.String name,
                               double default_value)
        Class should be extended and defined with their respective platform.
        Parameters:
        type - Platform type name
        name - The populator name
        default_value - Value to use where the populator is not defined

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        public final java.lang.String getType()

      • build

        public final void build(EnvironmentMap map,
                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> params)
        Public facing method to build the populator. Rejects maps of the wrong type before calling doBuild(EnvironmentMap, Map).
        Parameters:
        map - Map the populators should be added to
        params - Build parameters

      • doBuild

        protected abstract RecursiveGridList<java.lang.Double> doBuild(EnvironmentMap map,
                                                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> params)
        Abstract method to be implemented with the build method for the populator.
        Parameters:
        map - The map the populator is coupled with
        params - Build parameters
        Returns:
        RecursiveGridList of the same dimensionality as the map

      • getName

        public final java.lang.String getName()

      • getValue

        public double getValue(double... coordinates)
        Returns the value of the populator at the given coordinates. Returns the default value if the coordinates are out of range or build(EnvironmentMap, Map) has not been run. Populator values are defined to integer resolution using Math.floor(double).
        Parameters:
        coordinates - Position coordinates, should be the same dimension as the map.
        Returns:
        The value of the populator or default

      • getDisplayFunction

        public abstract PopulatorDisplayFunction getDisplayFunction()
        Abstract void should be overwritten to return a PopulatorDisplayFunction which converts the value of the populator to a color to be displayed on the map.
        Returns:
        A unique PopulatorDisplayFunction

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
